I would highly recommend Total Recall, a classic science fiction film starring Arnold Schwarzenegger.

Total Recall is set in the year 2054, where technology has advanced so much that people can choose to live new lives through a process called "Rekall."

In Total Recall, Douglas Quaid (played by Arnold Schwarzenegger), a factory worker, finds out that he had been living double his life: a happy and successful married couple with two young children.

But when Douglas Quaid meets Rekall's CEO, Harry Baig, who claims to be able to implant fake memories of a life they would like to have in order to help people achieve their dreams, Douglas Quaid begins to suspect that he has been living double his life: a happy and successful married couple with two young children.

He claims to be pursued by certain authorities who intend to prevent him from disclosing a secret that only he holds, whence the title. Is he lying, or insane  - or is he telling the truth? | Starring: Genevieve O'Reilly, Ash Cook, James Nesbitt
2. Title: Unstoppable  (2010) ) | Plot: Unstoppable: Icons of the 20th Century features intimate and revealing interviews with five famous women whose extraordinary accomplishments were threatened by the discovery of their sexuality: Tennis pioneer Billie Jean King, tennis superstar Martina Navratilova, Vietnam veteran Col. Margarethe Cammermeyer, former California State Senator and child actor Sheila Kuehl, and  'Married  ... With Children' actress Amanda Bearse. Their stories are woven together to provide an insightful look at their lives and how they impacted our world at a pivotal time in history.
| Starring:
